org.jtrim.cancel

Interface InterruptibleWait


  • public interface InterruptibleWait
    Defines a generic interface to wait for an event to occur. This interface was designed for the static CancelableWaits.await(CancellationToken, InterruptibleWait) method. See its documentation for further reference.
    See Also:
    CancelableWaits.await(CancellationToken, InterruptibleWait), InterruptibleLimitedWait

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void await()
      Waits until the implementation defined event occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • await

        void await()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits until the implementation defined event occurs. The static CancelableWaits.await(CancellationToken, InterruptibleWait) method calls this method, see its documentation how it uses this method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - thrown if the current thread was interrupted
